plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you‚Äôre building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It‚Äôs the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System ‚Äî with token-based color management built right in.

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File üìÇ: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants üé®: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components üöÄ: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Responsive Font-Size Generator (CSS clamp)
plugins.description:
Generate perfect CSS clamp() values for responsive typography in seconds


Transform your Figma text elements into production-ready responsive CSS with intelligent clamp() value generation. Select any text element and get perfectly scaled typography that works beautifully across all devices.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. Smart Typography Scaling: Mobile-first approach with 75-80% reduction for optimal readability
  2. Intelligent Variable Naming: Automatically suggests semantic CSS variable names (--h1-base, --h2-base, etc.)
  3. One-Click Workflow: Select text ‚Üí Copy clamp value ‚Üí Paste into CSS
  4. Container Query Ready: Uses modern cqw units for fluid responsive design
  5. Clean Output: Production-ready CSS with no unnecessary trailing zeros


üé® Example Output

--h1-base: clamp(1.88rem, 4.2cqw, 2.5rem);
--h2-base: clamp(1.5rem, 4.2cqw, 2rem);
--text-xl: clamp(1rem, 2.2cqw, 1.25rem);

No more manual calculations or responsive typography headaches ‚Äì just perfect clamp values, every time.


üîó Also check out our Figma to Oxygen Builder Plugin for complete design-to-WordPress conversion!


wpconverters.com
plugins.tagline: Get perfect responsive Font-Size properties

Pixabay Illustrations Library is a powerful Figma plugin that brings you an extensive collection of high-quality illustrations directly from Pixabay. With thousands of unique designs at your fingertips, you can easily enhance your projects and inspire creativity. Whether you're working on web designs, presentations, or marketing materials, our library offers diverse styles to suit any theme.


Key Features:


Vast Collection: Access thousands of free illustrations in various styles and categories.

Easy Integration: Seamlessly add illustrations to your designs without leaving Figma.

Search Functionality: Quickly find the perfect illustration using keywords or categories.

High-Quality Graphics: All images are royalty-free and suitable for commercial use.

Transform your design workflow with the Pixabay Illustrations Library and watch your creativity soar!
136917.tagline: Elevate Your Designs with Stunning Illustrations

plugins.name: DeepL Translator
plugins.description:
DeepL Translator


A Figma plugin that quickly translates text within frames using the DeepL API.

The acceleration feature enables faster translations and cost savings.


Features


  1. üöÄ Fast Translation: Re-use past translation history for fast fast translation
  2. üí∞Ô∏è Cost Saving: Save API Usage by Re-use past translation history
  3. üåê Multi-language Support: Supports 29 languages
  4. üìö Glossary Support: Use DeepL glossaries for consistent translations
  5. üåç Auto Detection: Automatic source language detection
  6. üìù Non-destructive: Creates new frames for translations while preserving originals
  7. üéØ Simple Operation: Just select languages and click translate


How to Use


  1. Get a DeepL API key (see below)
  2. Select a frame containing text to translate
  3. Choose source and target languages
  4. (Optional) Select a glossary
  5. Click "Translate"
  6. Translation results appear in a new frame


Getting a DeepL API Key


1. Sign up for a DeepL API account at DeepL.

  1. Free plan available (500,000 characters/month)
  2. Pro plan available for more usage

2. Get your API key:

  1. Log in to your DeepL account
  2. Go to "Account" ‚Üí "API keys"
  3. Copy your API key

3. Enter your API key in the plugin settings


Glossary


You can set up glossary on DeepL Web Console.

https://support.deepl.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021634540-About-the-glossary

https://www.deepl.com/ja/glossary?sortColumn=name&sortDirection=asc


Please let me know via feedback form if you have a good reason to edit the Glossary on the Plugin directly.


Supported Languages


See the complete list of supported languages for details.


Major languages include:


  1. English (EN)
  2. Chinese (ZH)
  3. Korean (KO)
  4. German (DE)
  5. French (FR)
  6. Spanish (ES)
  7. Italian (IT)
  8. Dutch (NL)
  9. Japanese (JA)
  10. Portuguese (PT)
  11. Russian (RU)


And 18 more languages


Notes


  1. DeepL API key required (available with free plan)
  2. Free plan includes 500,000 characters per month
  3. Source language must be specified when using glossaries
  4. API keys are securely encrypted and stored


Support & Feedback


We welcome your feedback! Please contact to developer through:


- Contact Form for:

  1. Questions & Inquiries
  2. Feature Requests
  3. Bug Reports
  4. General Feedback


Privacy

  1. DeepL API keys are securely encrypted
  2. Translation data is processed on DeepL servers and not stored on this plugin server.
plugins.tagline: Translate texts in Figma by DeepL

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Meet Scout, your trusty design detective‚Äîready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. üéØ


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout ‚ÄúHex!‚Äù


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantly‚Äîbecause who doesn't love instant magic? ‚ú®


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue is‚Äîno guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system first‚Äîit'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.


Scout is currently in beta. Found bugs? Have questions, suggestions, or feature requests? üíå DM me on Twitter

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It‚Äôs easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma‚Äôs menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

‚Ä¢ Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer‚Äôs text to "Hello World".


‚Ä¢ Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer‚Äôs text to "Welcome".


‚Ä¢ Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


‚Ä¢ Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


‚Ä¢ Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


‚Ä¢ Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you‚Äôll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúEnable Arabic Mode‚Äù or ‚ÄúDisable Arabic Mode‚Äù
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties ‚Äî please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúEnable Arabic Mode‚Äù or ‚ÄúDisable Arabic Mode‚Äù
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties ‚Äî please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
‚ú® Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs‚Äîfast.


üöÄ Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides‚Äîthey're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


üîç What it does:

‚Ä¢ Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography‚Äîflags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


‚Ä¢ Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


‚Ä¢ Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


‚Ä¢ Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


‚Ä¢ Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


‚Ä¢ Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


‚Ä¢ Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


‚Ä¢ Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


‚Ä¢ Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


‚Ä¢ Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


‚Ä¢ Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion‚Äîno guessing.


‚Ä¢ Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


üö¶ It detects:

‚úÖ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

‚úÖ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

‚úÖ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

‚úÖ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

‚úÖ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

‚úÖ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

‚úÖ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

‚úÖ Nested components causing potential performance issues

‚úÖ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


üé® How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


üí° Who it's for:

‚Ä¢ Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

‚Ä¢ Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

‚Ä¢ Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

‚Ä¢ Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

139251.name: Yet Another Design Linter
139251.description:
‚ú® Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs‚Äîfast.


üöÄ Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides‚Äîthey're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


üîç What it does:

‚Ä¢ Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography‚Äîflags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


‚Ä¢ Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


‚Ä¢ Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


‚Ä¢ Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


‚Ä¢ Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


‚Ä¢ Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


‚Ä¢ Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


‚Ä¢ Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


‚Ä¢ Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


‚Ä¢ Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


‚Ä¢ Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion‚Äîno guessing.


‚Ä¢ Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


üö¶ It detects:

‚úÖ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

‚úÖ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

‚úÖ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

‚úÖ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

‚úÖ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

‚úÖ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

‚úÖ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

‚úÖ Nested components causing potential performance issues

‚úÖ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


üé® How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


üí° Who it's for:

‚Ä¢ Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

‚Ä¢ Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

‚Ä¢ Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

‚Ä¢ Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

‚Ä¢ Teams transitioning to variable-based design workflows

‚Ä¢ Design system audits and cleanup

‚Ä¢ Onboarding new team members to design standards

‚Ä¢ Pre-handoff quality checks

Refactor variable handling and enhance UI components for improved user experience

- Introduce new message types and handlers for variable loading and caching, enhancing the management of design variables.
- Implement a loading overlay and progress indicators during variable processing, providing users with clear feedback on ongoing operations.
- Refactor the VariableCollectionListHandler and related components to improve error handling and user notifications, ensuring a smoother interaction flow.
- Update the UI to reflect changes in variable states, including loading and readiness, enhancing visual clarity and responsiveness.
- Remove deprecated components and streamline the codebase for better maintainability and performance.

plugins.name: Frames to Auto Layout
plugins.description:
We‚Äôve all done it‚Äìselected multiple frames and tried to add auto layout to each of them, only to find that instead of adding auto layout to every frame individually as expected, Figma annoyingly groups all your selected frames and organizes them in a single auto layout.


This simple plugin provides that missing, expected functionality for Figma. With this plugin, simply select all of the frames you want to add auto layout to and run the plugin, and voila‚Äîevery frame you selected will now have auto layout added, instead of the default Figma behavior of grouping the selected frames within a new frame and organizing your selected layers in a single auto layout‚Äîso annoying!


Currently the plugin simply sets the same default auto layout properties that the standard "add auto layout" UI button and command add‚Äîhorizontal directionality and 10px padding and spacing. I may consider adding to this plugin the ability to configure custom default properties with a separate command‚Äîplease comment if such a feature would interest you.

Currently Design Lead at Co:Create (www.cocreate.ink)
